text: some people think measles is just a rash
but the problem is it can be so much
more than that it can lead to really
serious complications things like brain

[Music]
in some ways vaccines may have become a
victim of their own success because
they're working so well doing what
they're supposed to do maybe people
aren't seeing the serious complications
of things like measles anymore and maybe
then thinking this isn't a serious
disease why would I need a vaccine but
that couldn't be further from the truth
[Music]
twenty years ago some now completely
discredited research published in The
Lancet medical journal which looked at
just 12 children sparked fears that the
MMR vaccine may somehow be linked to
childhood behavioral issues autism the
vast overwhelming majority of scientists
and medics around the world say this is
completely wrong and there has now been
loads of research to show there is no
link
[Music]
so this is the longest measles outbreak
in the United States since 2000 which is
when the CDC declared it officially
eradicated the problem is now that
social media can spread this bit of
misinformation more widely more quickly
and public health experts are really
worried that some parents may just be
hearing these more skeptical voices and
not hearing the important messages
they're putting out that vaccines can
save lives have been given safely to
millions of children worldwide the World
Health Organization says the measles
vaccine alone saved more than 20 million
lives in the last two decades
